title: Last surviving member of first team to scale Everest dies aged 92
byline: Kanchha Sherpa, the last surviving member of the first expedition to successfully scale the summit of Mount Everest, has died in the Nepali capital Kathmandu, aged 92.

title: National Action Plan to curb human-elephant conflict: AG
byline: The Attorney General yesterday informed the Court of Appeal that a National Action Plan is currently being prepared by the authorities for the mitigation of the human-elephant conflict in the country.

title: Courts allowed to work on holidays to clear pending court items by year-end
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has instructed all High Court judges and judicial officers that pending court production items must be cleared by December 31, 2025, as per Circular No. 422 A.

title: Around 25,000 people disabled due to road accidents
byline: Nearly 25,000 people suffer severe, long-term injuries each year as a result of road accidents, health officials have pointed out.

title: Engineer abandoned Port Access Elevated Highway project to drag 2 more years
byline: Delays to the completion of the Port Access Elevated Highway (PAEH) which would link Colombo City Centre and Katunayake Expressway (CKE) via the port has faced further delays with the Engineer Representative abandoning the project.

title: Sewwandi hid for three months in Matugama and Middeniya under female bodyguard protection
byline: Ishara Sewwandi, the suspect accused of disguising herself as a lawyer and supplying the revolver used in the courtroom assassination of underworld figure “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”, had spent three months in hiding in Matugama and Middeniya under the protection of female bodyguards, before she left for Nepal, police investigations have revealed.

title: Birds to decide on Renewable Projects previously offered to Adani
byline: Ahead of fresh tenders to be called for the two renewable energy projects previously offered to India’s Adani company, the Central Environment Authority (CEA) has sought to undertake a bird collision avoidance study, an official said.

title: Trump says he will meet Putin in Hungary for Ukraine talks after ’very productive’ call
byline: US President Donald Trump says ’’great progress’’ was made during a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday, with the pair agreeing to face-to-face talks in Hungary.

title: Several Coast Guard ships remain inactive for years, Audit finds
byline: An audit report has revealed that several Sri Lanka Coast Guard vessels remain inactive for years, while others await costly repairs or disposal.

title: India sees rupee bonds as next step in deepening Lanka ties
byline: In a significant signal of deepening economic ties, India is actively considering pathways to enable Sri Lankan entities, including the government and commercial businesses, to issue bonds denominated in

title: Economic activity strengthens ahead of year-end demand
byline: The continuous growth in economic activities was seen further from the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) data for September which showed persistent expansion in both manufacturing and services sectors which

title: Drug addicts to get jobs after rehabilitation: Watagala
byline: The government has planned to introduce a mechanism to recruit drug addicts for employment in government and private sectors after giving them vocational training on completion of the rehabilitation programme, Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala said today.

title: COPE slams CIDA for harassing staff, spending Rs. 15Mn on Court Case
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprise (COPE) has found fault with the Construction Industries Development Authority (CIDA) for harassing workers on personal grounds and for incurring exorbitant expenses for lawyers appearing in a court case filed against an employee attached to the institution.

title: UAE claim final T20 World Cup 2026 ticket in Oman
byline: United Arab Emirates have claimed a ticket to next year’s ICC Men’s T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, securing a top-three spot at the Asia/East Asia-Pacific Qualifier in Oman.

title: India casts doubt on Trump’s claim Modi will stop buying Russian oil
byline: India’s foreign ministry has said it is ’’not aware’’ of a phone call in which US President Donald Trump claimed Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi agreed to stop purchasing Russian oil.

title: CMC declares emergency disaster response period from October 16 to 18
byline: The Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has declared an emergency disaster response period from October 16 to 18, 2025.

title: LGC services partially disrupted but data secure: ICTA
byline: The Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) of Sri Lanka announced that partial disruptions to the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC) services continue, though critical systems remain secure and no data loss or security breaches have occurred.

title: CSE posts strong turnover driven by Banking and Capital Goods sectors
byline: Eroding the previous day’s losses, the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) generated a significant turnover of LKR 8.87 billion today. Both the All Share Price Index (ASPI) and the S&P SL20 maintained a steady rally throughout the session, with minor fluctuations, reflecting sustained investor optimism. Market volatility remained elevated, with the ASPI moving within the 22,300 to 22,450 range.

title: Three arrested for defrauding money using photos of children in Cancer Hospital
byline: Three individuals belonging to an organised gang were arrested for defrauding millions of money by posting on Facebook the photos fraudulently taken of children who are receiving treatment at the Apeksha Hospital, Maharagama.

title: Sri Lanka Customs records highest-ever daily revenue
byline: Sri Lanka Customs achieved its highest-ever daily revenue collection yesterday (15), marking a historic milestone in the institution’s history.

title: Public warned to exercise caution when obtaining online, mobile loans
byline: Police warned the public to exercise caution when obtaining loans via the Internet or mobile phones, following an increase in complaints related to deceptive lending practices.

title: All female MPs to wear pink to support cancer awareness
byline: All female parliamentarians and parliamentary staff have decided to wear pink on a selected day in the next parliamentary week to support Breast Cancer Awareness.

title: Special bus services for Diwali long weekend
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced special bus services to accommodate the increased passenger demand during the Diwali long weekend starting tomorrow (17).

title: S Korea tycoon escapes paying $1bn in ’divorce of the century’
byline: South Korea’s Supreme Court has struck down a lower court’s order for billionaire Chey Tae-won to pay his ex-wife a 1.38tn won ($1bn; £788m) settlement, in a case dubbed by local media as the ’’divorce of the century’’.

title: Over 300,000 driver’s licenses await issuance: Officials revealed
byline: Officials from the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation informed the Ministerial Consultative Committee that over 300,000 driver’s licenses are currently pending issuance. Arrangements have been made to print and distribute these licenses within the next three months.

title: Child abuse cases rise, warns HRCSL
byline: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has raised alarm over an increase in reports of child rights violations, particularly cases of corporal punishment.

title: Inland Revenue exceeds tax collection target by September
byline: Sri Lanka’s Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has surpassed its expected tax collection for the first nine months of 2025, recording 102 percent of the target by the end of September, officials informed the Parliamentary Committee on Ways and Means.

title: Sri Lanka’s former cricketer Warnaweera dies at 64
byline: Sri Lanka’s former cricketer Jayananda Warnaweera passed away today at the age of 64.

title: My client never sang obscene songs - Counsel denies police claim
byline: The President’s Counsel appearing on behalf of Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake yesterday (15) informed the Court that the police had wrongly accused his client of committing an offence under Section 287 of the Penal Code, alleging that he had sung obscene songs at the Mount Lavinia Court premises.

title: PM Harini meets Jaishankar
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya began her official visit to India today with a meeting with Indian Minister of External Affairs Dr. S. Jaishankar in New Delhi.

title: Heavy rainfall over 100mm on the cards
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned of showers in most parts of the island with heavy rainfall exceeding 100mm expected in several areas.

title: Army Paralympic gold medalist dies in train accident
byline: A Sri Lanka Army officer and Paralympic gold medalist, Warnakulasuriya Amila Prashan, has died after being hit by a train in the Madurankuliya area.

title: Sri Lanka secures $106.9 Million from ADB
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has secured financial assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to support the Strengthening Integrated Health Care and Governance for Universal Health Coverage Program.

title: Severe lightning warning issued for several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a severe lightning advisory for the Central, North-Central, Sabaragamuwa, Uva, and North-Western provinces, as well as the Ampara District, effective until 11:00 PM today.

title: Penal Code (Amendment) Bill will not be enacted if people reject it: President
byline: Commenting on the Penal Code (Amendment) Bill, which seeks to ban corporal punishment, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today the government will not enact in Parlaiment any Act which the people do not agreed to.

title: Allowance paid to teachers in rural schools to be increased in upcoming budget: President
byline: Steps will be taken in the upcoming budget to increase the allowance paid to teachers in rural schools, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Magnitude 6.1 quake hits southern Philippines
byline: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake jolted southern Philippines on Friday (Oct 17), the United States Geological Survey said, a week after two powerful quakes hit the country.

title: Delhi University’s Hindu College honours PM Harini Amarasuriya with new research lab
byline: In recognition of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya’s academic and public achievements, Hindu College, University of Delhi, has inaugurated a new research facility named the “Harini Amarasuriya Social & Ethnographic Research Lab.”

title: MR’s former security officer further remanded
byline: Neville Wanni Arachchi, the former security officer of ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa, was further remanded till October 31 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.

title: BIA extendes check-in for departures
byline: Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) announced today that passengers departing from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) will be allowed to check in four hours before their scheduled departure.

title: Bears kill seven people in Japan this year as attacks hit record high
byline: The number of people killed by bears in Japan this year has reached a record high, the country’s environment ministry has said.

title: Local gold prices soar amid global rise
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has risen sharply, following increases in the global market.

title: Death penalty sought for Bangladesh’s ex-leader Sheikh Hasina
byline: Prosecutors in Bangladesh have demanded that former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina be put to death over a deadly crackdown on student-led protests last year that ousted her from power.

title: Man killed, daughter injured in Wennappuwa accident
byline: A tragic accident occurred this morning near Gorak Gas Handiya on the Wennappuwa New Road when a van carrying schoolchildren collided with a motorcycle, killing the motorcyclist.

title: Last surviving member of first team to scale Everest dies aged 92
byline: Kanchha Sherpa, the last surviving member of the first expedition to successfully scale the summit of Mount Everest, has died in the Nepali capital Kathmandu, aged 92.
